items.title: Brookings: Global Economy 2026 Outlook - Multilateralism Must Evolve
items.summary: Brookings Global Economy and Development program identifies 2026 as a year of opportunity amid geopolitical turbulence. The world faces transformative change from geopolitics to technology, requiring new approaches to multilateralism and global economic governance aligned with new economic and geopolitical realities.
items.raw_content: 2026 could be year of opportunity according to Brahima S. Coulibaly. Publication of 'Quo Vadis Multilateralism? International Cooperation in a Changing Global Order' and research on managing transformative technological change. Focus on Africa's democratic resilience, AI labor market impacts, education transformation.

items.title: RAND: Five Hard National Security Problems from AGI
items.summary: RAND identifies five critical national security challenges posed by AGI development: wonder weapons, systemic power shifts, empowered non-experts developing WMDs, artificial entities with agency, and strategic instability. Expert judgment suggests AGI could emerge between 2030-2040.
items.raw_content: Congressional testimony by RAND vice president warns AGI emergence is plausible and requires serious planning. Five hard problems identified. Uncertainty substantial but near-term emergence requires preparation by national security agencies.

items.title: CFR: Five Foreign Policy Trends for 2026
items.summary: CFR identifies five critical foreign policy trends: China's dominance in critical minerals, rising tariff costs (67% borne by consumers by mid-2026), New START treaty expiration in February 2026, rise of the 'electrostate' with China leading electrification, and women bearing brunt of US foreign aid cuts.
items.raw_content: Economic modeling suggests 67% of tariff burdens passed to American consumers by mid-2026. Russia's New START expires February 2026. China surpasses West in electrification, dominating solar, EV, battery exports. Critical minerals strategic vulnerability.

items.title: McKinsey: AI-Human Partnerships Could Unlock $2.9 Trillion by 2030
items.summary: MGI estimates AI-powered agents and robots could unlock $2.9 trillion in annual economic value in the US by 2030, but only if organizations redesign work around human-AI partnerships. Today's technologies could automate activities accounting for more than half of US work hours.
items.raw_content: Fewer than 40% of AI adopters report measurable profit gains. Real productivity requires reimagining workflows. Organizations must treat AI as core business transformation, invest in skills development. Technology alone won't deliver productivity.

items.title: PIIE: Global Growth Slowing to 2.9% in 2026 Amid Tariff Headwinds
items.summary: PIIE projects real global GDP to rise 3.1% in 2025 and 2.9% in 2026, down from 3.3% last year. Tariffs at highest levels since 1930s reduce US growth by 0.62 percentage points in 2026. Inflation projected above 3% through year-end 2026, potentially reaching 4.5% by mid-2026.
items.raw_content: US GDP growth moderates to 1.7% in 2026. PCE inflation peaks above 3.5% early 2026. Tariffs reduce growth by 0.23pp in 2025, 0.62pp in 2026. President Posen warns markets underestimate inflation persistence - likely 4.5% or more by mid-2026.

items.title: WEF Global Risks 2025: Inequality Most Central Risk
items.summary: WEF's 20th Global Risks Report identifies inequality (wealth, income) as the most central, interconnected risk. Algorithmic bias in AI applications can perpetuate or exacerbate inequities. 2026 may be the year of 'AI reckoning' after 2025's AI hype.
items.raw_content: Inequality ranks #7 in two-year outlook. Societal polarization and economic instability complicate collective action. Generative AI creates false content at scale. If 2025 was AI hype, 2026 might be AI reckoning year.

items.title: WEF Future of Jobs: 170M New Roles, 92M Displaced by 2030
items.summary: WEF Future of Jobs Report 2025 projects 170 million new roles created and 92 million displaced, resulting in net increase of 78 million jobs by 2030. Half of employers plan to reorient business for AI; two-thirds will hire for AI skills; 40% anticipate workforce reduction where AI automates tasks.
items.raw_content: Nearly two-fifths of existing job skills predicted to change within 5 years. Convergence of demographic shifts, deglobalization, AI acceleration exposes systemic labor market weaknesses. Half of employers reorienting for AI.

items.title: Atlantic Council: Trump AI Action Plan - Export Controls Over Collaboration
items.summary: Trump administration's AI Action Plan prioritizes reducing regulatory barriers, expediting data center construction, and exporting AI solutions to allies. Critics warn approach prioritizes 'dominance alone' over collaborative governance, offering 'all sticks, few carrots' for international partnerships.
items.raw_content: Budget cuts to NSF could impact AI priorities. Plan emphasizes full tech stack from semiconductors to talent. Open-source AI competitive importance recognized. Approach may alienate allies invested in values-based AI safeguards.

items.title: Carnegie: Task Force Warns Against Nuclear Anarchy Era
items.summary: Carnegie-Harvard-NTI Task Force warns that risks of nuclear weapons spread are growing due to simultaneous shifts in geopolitics and technology. Apart from Iran, most plausible proliferators are US allies or security partners. Trump administration shows concern but announced potential nuclear testing resumption.
items.raw_content: VP Vance stated 'president hates nuclear proliferation'. Concern about nuclear escalation drives diplomacy efforts including Ukraine war, India-Pakistan ceasefire. Trump Truth Social post indicates nuclear testing on 'equal basis' with other countries.

items.title: CSIS: China Military Modernization for Taiwan by 2027 Goal
items.source_name: Center for Strategic and International Studies
items.summary: Xi Jinping ordered PLA to be ready to seize Taiwan by force by 2027, though DoD officials say 'short, sharp invasion not possible right now'. China's defense spending grew from one-sixth to one-third of US levels (2012-2024). In Indo-Pacific, China spends 5x Japan, 7x South Korea.
items.raw_content: PLA Navy surpassed US Navy in battle force ships around 2014. Beijing's 2027 goal requires three strategic capabilities. Only 13% US experts, 6% Taiwan experts believe 2027 timeline impacts invasion decision. CSIS warns against conflating modernization goals with action timeline.

items.title: Chatham House: Climate Finance Shortfall Deepens North-South Tensions
items.summary: Chatham House warns persistent shortfall in development and climate finance will deepen tensions between advanced economies and developing countries over energy transition cost distribution. US tariff war highlights China's dominance in critical mineral processing as potential chokepoint for clean energy transition.
items.raw_content: Interest from European, Asian, Gulf countries growing to secure cobalt, copper, minerals for energy transition. Partnerships in DRC-Zambia cobalt-copper belt likely to expand in 2026. Competition for critical raw materials, land, water intensifying.

items.title: Atlantic Council: G20 Moving Forward on AI Governance, US Risks Being Left Out
items.summary: G20 leaders in Johannesburg signaled alignment around approaching AI and data as vehicles for inclusive and sustainable development rather than primarily instruments of geopolitical competition. Reflects important shift in how states position themselves on AI governance, with potential US isolation.
items.raw_content: Important shift from geopolitical competition framing to development framing. US-China competing AI action plans July 2025. GeoTech Commission launched to ensure US technological preeminence in AI-defined world.

items.title: Brookings AI Education Task Force: 45% High Schoolers Use ChatGPT for Mental Health
items.summary: Brookings Global Task Force on AI in Education finds 45% of high school students already use ChatGPT for friendship, relationship, and mental health issues. Researchers worry about reduced opportunities for critical social interactions essential for emotional intelligence, empathy, communication skills.
items.raw_content: January 14, 2026 event with Kara Swisher discusses task force findings. If not used well, generative AI could increase student disengagement, reduce critical thinking, expand inequities, undermine learner resilience and agency.

items.title: McKinsey: AI Skills Demand Surged 6.8x in Two Years
items.summary: McKinsey data reveals demand for AI-fluent workers surged 6.8 times over two years - from 1 million to 7 million employees. Nearly all growth in non-technical roles (managers, analysts, marketers, operational staff). 75% of knowledge workers already use AI tools, often without formal company deployment.
items.raw_content: 80% of tech organizations say upskilling most effective for reducing skills gaps, but only 28% planning to invest in upskilling programs next 2-3 years. This is upskilling challenge rather than hiring problem.

items.title: OECD: 145 Countries Agree on Global Minimum Tax 'Side-by-Side' System
items.source_name: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
items.summary: Over 145 countries agreed on package charting course for coordinated operation of global minimum tax arrangements in digitalised, globalised economy. New guidance exempts US-headquartered multinationals from key portions of minimum tax, creating 'side-by-side' system.
items.raw_content: January 5, 2026 announcement covers new guidance for global corporate minimum tax regime. Side-by-side system preserves but potentially weakens global minimum tax. Digital continuous transactional reporting for VAT also released January 2026.

items.title: IMF-World Bank: $4.5 Trillion EMDE Bond Debt Matures by 2026
items.summary: Over USD 4.5 trillion of emerging market and developing economy bond debt matures between 2024-2026, creating significant refinancing pressure. Among countries where >30% of foreign currency debt due by end 2026, 10 have credit ratings BB- or lower. External debt reached record $8.9 trillion in 2024.
items.raw_content: Interest payments climbed to all-time high of $415 billion. 13 countries in or nearly in default representing $1.4 trillion GDP, 400 million people. Many EMDEs face high financing costs, large external refinancing needs, decline in net external flows.

items.title: IMF World Economic Outlook: Global Growth 3.1% (2026), Down from 3.3%
items.summary: IMF January 2026 update projects world economic growth slowing from 3.3% in 2024 to 3.2% in 2025 and 3.1% in 2026, below historical 2000-19 average of 3.7%. Global headline inflation expected to decline to 4.2% in 2025 and 3.5% in 2026.
items.raw_content: Press briefing January 19, 10:30 CET at National Bank of Belgium Brussels. Forecast for 2025 broadly unchanged from October 2024. Growth remains below pre-pandemic averages amid multiple headwinds.

items.title: National Quantum Initiative Reauthorization Act 2026 Introduced
items.summary: Senators Todd Young and Maria Cantwell introduced bipartisan National Quantum Initiative Reauthorization Act extending NQI by five years through December 2034. Authorizes $85M annually for fiscal years 2026-2030 for QIST research at NIST, plus $25M for quantum research at NASA.
items.raw_content: Defense agencies study quantum for cyber warfare, intelligence, encryption dominance. Future quantum computers could crack cryptographic systems protecting government data. Malicious actors can steal encrypted data now and wait for quantum decryption capability.

items.title: AEI-RAND: 2026 Critical Year for Post-Quantum Cryptography Transition
items.summary: AEI and RAND analysis identifies 2026 as year when quantum systems move from labs into real-world impact on cryptography, security, trust. Governments pledged >$20 billion toward quantum development with China leading public funding. Quantum computing market projected to cross $10-15B by 2026.
items.raw_content: President signed NSM 10 in May 2022 prioritizing mitigating risks to encryption. NIST PQC standards announced 2024. RAND-CISA assessed all 55 National Critical Functions face risks from quantum computing. Allied militaries should clarify strategy for quantum threat response.

items.title: Synthetic Biology Governance: Rise of Soft Law Framework
items.summary: New governance framework for synthetic biology emphasizes soft law flexibility and consensus-building to supplement hard law (BWC, CBD). Collaborative model characterized by 'soft law guidance, hard law consolidation, soft law feedback' aims to create flexible, enforceable governance framework for dual-use risks.
items.raw_content: Hard law faces structural limitations in technical adaptability, scope, institutional coordination. Soft law non-binding nature enables rapid response to ethical risks. Systematic precautionary governance approach needed for dual-use of synthetic biology with national and international cooperation.

items.title: Research: Political Polarization Erodes Social Trust in Democracy
items.summary: New research finds perceptions of partisan divisions and polarization make people less trusting of fellow citizens, eroding social cohesion essential for democracy. Trust in fellow citizens is backbone of well-functioning democracy. Shared values foster social trust, but perceived polarization undermines it.
items.raw_content: Democracy faces perfect storm: increasing grievance, social/political change, technological advancement, global instability. Polarization blamed for populism, erosion of social cohesion, loss of institutional trust, legislative dysfunction, failure to address existential risks like climate change.

items.title: Institutional Design Study: Consensus Democracies Better at Fighting Polarization
items.summary: Research finds institutional design matters for polarization levels. Creating 'right' institutional conditions through consensus democracy mechanisms may significantly reduce polarization compared to majoritarian systems. Main recommendation: strengthen political education oriented toward democratic values, tolerance, cross-cultural understanding.
items.raw_content: Shared societal values essential for social cohesion and regime stability. Cross-national variations in polarization explained by institutional trust, social cohesion variations, globalization effects. Strengthening democratic values education key recommendation.

items.title: FAA Part 450 Space Regulations Full Implementation March 10, 2026
items.summary: Entirety of Part 450 will apply to all launch and reentry licenses starting March 10, 2026. Legacy licenses expire on this date. FAA Associate Administrator describes timeline as 'very challenging' given number of legacy licenses not yet transitioned. Extension needed to prevent halting commercial operations.
items.raw_content: Part 450 creates single set of performance-based regulations for all space vehicles, replacing legacy regulations. Numerous licensees risk becoming noncompliant without deadline extension, causing major setbacks for American space innovation.

items.title: Trump EO on Space: Novel Space Activity Authorizations by April 2026
items.summary: Trump's Executive Order 14335 streamlines commercial space licensing, expedites environmental reviews, creates novel space activity authorizations. Within 120 days (by April 17, 2026), Commerce Secretary must complete spectrum leadership review including opportunities for reapportioning and sharing spectrum.
items.raw_content: NASA must review international civil space cooperation arrangements to ensure alignment with EO priorities. FCC advanced spectrum reforms, opening ~20,000 MHz for satellite use. Government plans to amend 2016 Space Activities Act for suborbital flights, reusable launch systems, human spaceflight.

items.title: RAND-CISA: US Allies Must Prepare for Quantum Threat to Military Cryptography
items.summary: RAND-CISA analysis finds risks from quantum computing to all 55 National Critical Functions. Allied governments, especially militaries, should clarify strategy for responding to quantum cryptography threat to ensure future interoperability of secure communications against quantum attacks.
items.raw_content: Each of 55 National Critical Functions faces quantum risks. Allied military communications must transition to quantum-resistant encryption while maintaining interoperability. Strategic planning essential for coordinated response.

items.title: ITIF: Policy Reforms Needed to Launch US Space Innovation
items.summary: ITIF identifies critical policy reforms needed for US space innovation leadership. March 2026 compliance deadline should be extended to prevent halting commercial operations. Legacy licensing transition challenging numerous operators simultaneously.
items.raw_content: Without deadline extension, numerous licensees become noncompliant causing major setbacks. Regulatory streamlining essential for maintaining US competitiveness in commercial space sector.

items.title: Migration Policy Institute: Immigration Taking Pressure Off Labor Market
items.summary: MPI Labor Markets Initiative analysis shows immigration policy should respond to shifting US labor market needs while improving wages and safeguarding labor standards for both American and immigrant workers. Immigration currently taking pressure off job market amid tight labor conditions.
items.raw_content: Policy recommendations rethink immigration in light of economic crisis context, growing income inequality, globalization concerns, competition for highly skilled migrants, demographic and technological change.

items.title: Chatham House Climate and Energy Summit 2026: Geopolitics Reshaping Energy Markets
items.summary: Chatham House Climate and Energy Summit 2026 examines market-level implications at intersection of economic, national, energy security policy. Current geopolitical dynamics impacting energy transition, climate change, biodiversity efforts against backdrop of growing security concerns, trade wars, regional conflicts.
items.raw_content: Key topic: How Europe should manage reliance on China while advancing energy transition, seizing economic opportunities, balancing trade-offs. Geopolitics, technology, consumer behavior reshaping energy markets in Europe and beyond.

items.title: Brookings Africa: Critical Minerals Value Chains Focus for 2026
items.summary: Brookings Foresight Africa 2026 to focus on private capital mobilization in critical minerals value chains. US-Africa relations increasingly strategic around critical minerals. DRC-Zambia cobalt-copper belt partnerships expected to expand significantly in 2026.
items.raw_content: Private sector emerging as central to African development. Critical minerals becoming strategic for US-Africa partnership. Interest from European, Asian, Gulf countries growing to secure minerals for energy transition.

items.title: Brookings Education: AI Anxieties and Learning Transformation in 2026
items.summary: Brookings to publish 'From Luddite Fears to AI Anxieties: Managing Transformative Technological Change' in 2026. Global symposia on collaborative education system transformation planned across five continents. Focus on youth agency and voice in education increasingly important.
items.raw_content: Education systems increasingly focused on youth agency and voice. AI adoption intensifying labor market anxieties globally. Launch of AI and learning research across five continents planned for 2026.

items.title: CFR: New START Expiration February 2026 Creates Nuclear Instability
items.summary: Russia's New START treaty expires in February 2026, potentially unleashing unconstrained nuclear weapons deployments. US and Russia have broken, withdrawn from, or suspended all but one arms control agreement. End of arms control era with no verification mechanisms.
items.raw_content: New START expiration February 2026 ends last major US-Russia arms control agreement. No verification mechanisms remaining. Potential for unconstrained nuclear arsenal expansion by both powers.

items.title: CFR: China's 'Electrostate' Dominance in Global Energy Transition
items.summary: CFR identifies rise of China's 'electrostate' - surpassing Western nations in electrification by dominating solar, EV, and battery exports globally. China's strategic advantage in entire clean energy supply chain creates dependencies for Western energy transition goals.
items.raw_content: China dominates solar panel production, EV manufacturing, battery technology, and entire supply chains. Western nations dependent on Chinese clean energy technology for energy transition targets.

items.title: CFR: American Consumers to Bear 67% of Tariff Costs by Mid-2026
items.summary: CFR economic modeling suggests American consumers will bear approximately 67% of tariff burdens by mid-2026, driving inflation. Importers have been front-loading shipments and temporarily absorbing costs, but this is unsustainable. Tariff impact on prices mostly still lies ahead.
items.raw_content: Front-loading and cost absorption by importers temporary. Most tariff impact on consumer prices still ahead. 67% of burden falling on American consumers by mid-2026 based on economic modeling.

items.title: CSIS: Poor Intelligence Sharing Hampers Indo-Pacific Alliance Coordination
items.source_name: Center for Strategic and International Studies
items.summary: CSIS report identifies China's military advancement in Indo-Pacific demands coordinated response but finds poor intelligence sharing, burdensome arms sales procedures, limited multinational strategic planning among allies hampers effectiveness. No single nation can manage challenge alone.
items.raw_content: China's Indo-Pacific military capabilities require coordinated ally response. Major challenges: poor intelligence sharing, burdensome arms sales processes, limited multinational planning. Alliance coordination essential but currently inadequate.

items.title: CSIS: Alliance Cost-Sharing Agreements Expire 2026-2030
items.source_name: Center for Strategic and International Studies
items.summary: CSIS analysis highlights South Korea agreement ($1.05B in 2025, $1.14B in 2026) expires in 2030. Japan agreement (~$1.5B in 2025) expires in 2026, covering costs of US force stationing. Renegotiation period creates uncertainty for Indo-Pacific security architecture.
items.raw_content: South Korea agreement: $1.05B (2025), $1.14B (2026), expires 2030. Japan agreement ~$1.5B (2025), expires 2026. Cost-sharing for US force stationing up for renegotiation amid heightened tensions.

items.title: WEF: Global Cooperation Barometer 2026 Shows Reconfiguration
items.summary: WEF Global Cooperation Barometer 2026 Third Edition highlights where cooperation is persisting, weakening, and being reconfigured in response to shifting economic, political, technological realities. Good decisions could lead to sustainable, fair, thriving future; poor ones could deepen inequality and environmental strain.
items.raw_content: Cooperation persisting in some areas, weakening in others, reconfiguring amid economic, political, technological shifts. Decision quality determines whether future is sustainable and fair or marked by deepening inequality and environmental strain.

items.title: Chatham House: Water Governance for Sustainable Trade
items.summary: Chatham House conference examines how governments, businesses, communities can ensure water is protected, shared equitably, managed sustainably in production and consumption of traded goods. In era of global shocks, water governance critical for sustainability.
items.raw_content: Sustainability Accelerator initiative combines evidence-based policymaking with entrepreneurship experimental approach. Water protection, equitable sharing, sustainable management in traded goods focus for 2026.

items.title: RAND: How AGI Could Affect Rise and Fall of Nations
items.summary: RAND research explores possible impacts of AGI development on geopolitics and world order by developing potential future scenarios for AGI governance and effects on global power dynamics. AGI development may fundamentally reshape international power structures and national competitiveness.
items.raw_content: Potential future scenarios for AGI governance developed. Effects on global power dynamics analyzed. AGI could fundamentally reshape rise and fall of nations based on governance approaches and technological control.

items.title: RAND: US-China AGI Race Intensifying Amid Strategic Competition
items.summary: As humanity approaches technological capacity to develop AGI, race between leading AI powers - particularly US and China - is intensifying amid broader US-China strategic competition. AGI development timeline uncertainty substantial but plausible between 2030-2040.
items.raw_content: AGI race between US and China intensifying. Timeline plausibly 2030-2040 with substantial uncertainty. Competition embedded in broader strategic rivalry. Governance approaches will determine competitive outcomes.

items.title: RAND: Europe Needs AGI Preparedness Plan for Geopolitical Competition
items.summary: RAND analysis argues Europe needs comprehensive AGI preparedness plan as expert judgment suggests AGI could emerge 2030-2040 or even earlier. Europe risks being left behind in US-China AGI competition without strategic planning.
items.raw_content: Expert judgment: AGI plausible 2030-2040 or earlier. Europe needs strategic preparedness plan. Risk of being marginalized in US-China AGI race. Comprehensive planning essential for European competitiveness.

items.title: RAND: Beyond Manhattan Project for AGI - $100B Training Costs by 2027
items.summary: RAND commentary discusses AGI development approaches, noting models becoming more expensive to train - potentially reaching $100 billion by 2027 - making them critical national assets requiring protection from theft and manipulation. Program would invest heavily in evidence-based safety and security research.
items.raw_content: AI model training costs potentially $100B by 2027. Models become critical national assets requiring protection. Heavy investment in evidence-based safety and security research essential. AGI development requires coordinated national effort.

items.title: RAND-Harvard-NTI: US Allies Most Likely Future Nuclear Proliferators
items.summary: Task Force concludes US retains vital interest in thwarting nuclear weapons spread. Apart from Iran, most plausible states that might seek nuclear weapons in near future are US allies or security partners. Geopolitical and technological shifts simultaneously increasing proliferation risks.
items.raw_content: Most plausible proliferators: US allies/partners, not adversaries. Simultaneous geopolitical and technological shifts increasing risks. US must strengthen principles and adapt tools for nonproliferation objectives.

items.title: Carnegie: Domestic Extremists Show Fascination with Nuclear Violence
items.summary: Carnegie research finds most advanced democracies facing increasing challenges from domestic extremists who often have fascination with nuclear violence, including groups like Atomwaffen Division. Liberal democracies need greater role in setting norms for deployment of powerful new technologies of war.
items.raw_content: Domestic extremists in advanced democracies show nuclear violence fascination. Atomwaffen Division example cited. Liberal democracies should play greater role setting norms for powerful war technologies deployment.

items.title: Carnegie: Iran Nuclear Crisis Implications Stretch Beyond Tehran
items.summary: Carnegie analysis warns Iran nuclear crisis implications could stretch far beyond Tehran, affecting global nonproliferation regime. January 6, 2026 newsletter covered Iranian President warning Iran's answer to attack would be harsh, responding to Trump warning over nuclear program reconstruction.
items.raw_content: Iran nuclear program reconstruction ongoing. Trump warnings issued. Iranian President Pezeshkian threatens harsh response to attacks. Crisis has implications for global nonproliferation architecture beyond Iran.

items.title: Carnegie: Digital Sovereignty Requires Tech Company Accountability
items.summary: Carnegie Tech and Democracy program argues governments must insist on transparency and accountability regarding tech companies wielding geopolitical influence to ensure digital sovereignty. Technology governance essential for democratic resilience.
items.raw_content: Digital sovereignty requires government action on tech company transparency and accountability. Tech companies wielding geopolitical influence. Governance essential for democratic systems resilience.

items.title: Carnegie: Nuclear Energy Deployment Requires New Governance Structures
items.summary: Carnegie experts from government, industry, academia examined nuclear energy deployment assumptions, identified emerging challenges, considered approaches for shaping future governance structures, practices, behaviors. Beyond gigawatt expansion, governance modernization essential.
items.raw_content: Experts examined nuclear energy deployment governance needs. Future governance structures, practices, behaviors considered. Emerging challenges identified. Comprehensive approach beyond capacity expansion required.

items.title: Spiritual Crisis: Values Shift and Social Meaning-Making in Polarized Era
items.summary: Research identifies crisis in shared values and meaning-making as societies fragment. Belief that members share common values fosters social trust, but polarization makes people less trusting. Shared societal values sought as essential for social cohesion and regime stability, but rapidly eroding.
items.raw_content: Shared values essential for social cohesion and regime stability but eroding. Polarization undermines belief in common values. Social trust depends on perception of shared values. Values fragmentation represents spiritual crisis for democracies.
